intro: Phyllanthus bupleuroides, commonly known as the blue mistflower, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a member of the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue-gray foliage and clusters of small, inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its botanical features include alternate, ovate leaves with a smooth texture and a compact, shrub-like growth habit. It is often cultivated for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators.
